title: The Multi-Parameter Portal
story: "Excellent progress! Now combine multiple inputs. Create a method 'Add' that takes two integers 'a' and 'b' and returns their sum."
starterCode:
// Define Add(int a, int b) that returns a + b

int result = Add(17, 25);
solution: int Add(int a, int b) { return a + b; }
hints: Multiple parameters are separated by commas
int Add(int a, int b) defines a method with two int parameters
int Add(int a, int b) { return a + b; }

steps.explanation:
Methods can take MORE than one input! Just separate parameters with commas.

Think of it like a spell that needs multiple ingredients to work.
steps.tip: Common examples: Add(a, b), Max(x, y), CreateUser(name, email)
Parameters are separated by commas, both in the definition AND when calling.

steps.explanation:
When CALLING a method with multiple parameters, pass values in the same order:

Add(17, 25)  // a=17, b=25

The first value goes to the first parameter, second to second, etc.
steps.tip: Order matters! Add(17, 25) and Add(25, 17) give the same result for addition, but not for subtraction!
Don't go overboard - if a method needs more than 3-4 parameters, consider refactoring.

steps.explanation:
For this challenge:

1. Return type: int
2. Method name: Add
3. Parameters: int a, int b
4. Body: return a + b

Simple and clean!

exploration.introduction: Methods can take multiple inputs! Let's explore how to work with several parameters.

examples.title: Two Parameters
examples.explanation:
This method takes two numbers and returns their sum. Both parameters are integers.

Try different number combinations!

examples.title: Different Parameter Types
examples.explanation:
Parameters don't all have to be the same type. This method takes a string and a number.

It repeats the greeting the specified number of times.

examples.title: Order Matters!
examples.explanation:
With subtraction and division, the order of arguments matters!

Subtract(10, 3) is NOT the same as Subtract(3, 10).

examples.title: Your Turn!
examples.explanation:
Create an Add method that:
- Takes two int parameters: a and b
- Returns their sum (a + b)

Test with Add(17, 25) - should return 42!
